newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia's Medco to get loan for cement factory.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia's Medco to get loan for cement factory.

text.p: Indonesia's PT Semen Gombong, a unit of the Medco group, will get a 334 billion rupiah loan from government banks led by PT Bank Bumi Daya and PT Bank Negara Indonesia to build a cement factory in Central Java, the company said on Wednesday.
Semen Gombong will also get a $45 million standby letter of credit facility from Bank PDFCI.
The company said it would build a 1.9 million tonnes per year capacity cement factory in Central Java at a cost of about 1.1 trillion rupiah.
Hitler Singawinata, Semen Gombong president director, said the factory was expected to be completed in the end of 1999 or early 2000.
"We see good prospects for cement demand in Indonesia in the long term, so we are optimistic about the project," he said.
The company said it would seek $155 million from a foreign bank syndicate for the rest of the funding. It said 377 billion rupiah would come from internal sources.
